html: Those who seek peace in human treaties end up being betrayed. Their willingness to believe others’ lies stems from a kind of self-deception. Justice and righteousness alone beget true and lasting peace: “The effect of justice shall be peace, and the result of righteousness an assured calm forever” (Isaiah 32:17). By making peaceable agreements, then deliberately breaking them, the archtyrant takes advantage of gullible enemies (v 1). In his treacherous attack on Jehovah’s people, he devastates their lands from the mountains of Lebanon to the great Sharon Plain, to the ranges of Bashan and Carmel.
